title: Augusta County: John Quincy Adams Nadenbousch to Hester J. Nadenbousch, July 26, 1864
summary: Nadenbousch writes his wife and reports a safe arrival in Staunton after a difficult journey. He says that Freddy is doing well, and mentions the work he does at the hotel. He also discusses his efforts to sell the hotel, including his decision to hold on to it until after the war to take advantage of better currency values. He also discusses supplies he is shipping from home.
keywords: Family, Home Front, Women, American Civil War
